form.name: form1

div.style: color: #222222; font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: small; background-color: #ffffff

span.style: font-size: 12pt; font-family: Arial; color: #000000; background-color: transparent; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap

p.span: Hello Valley Indian Students and Parents,

span.style: font-size: 12pt; font-family: Arial; color: #000000; background-color: transparent; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap

p.span: With the announcement last week from the Governor concerning the closure of school for the remainder of this school year, the following items outline the remainder of the 2019/20 school year.

span.style: font-size: 12pt; font-family: Arial; color: #000000; background-color: transparent; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap

p.span: We are very proud of the work produced by the teachers and the return we are getting from most of the students. Although this is not the normal environment, we are hopeful that the students were able to obtain new learning and expand on their academic paths.

span.style: font-size: 12pt; font-family: Arial; color: #000000; background-color: transparent; font-weight: 700; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap
font-size: 12pt; font-family: Arial; color: #000000; background-color: transparent; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap

p.span: After many discussions and research on what to do with the 4th nine weeks work that was completed, we are going with our A-F grading system for grades 3-12. Grade levels below grade 3 do not use letter grades and will continue their grading practices.

span.style: font-size: 12pt; font-family: Arial; color: #000000; background-color: transparent; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap

p.span: Final grades for the buildings will be calculated differently. The elementary and middle school will issue a letter grade for the 4th nine weeks, but the final grade will consist of the first three nine weeks average, students were physically in school during that time. The high school will use the 4th nine weeks as part of the final grade, along with the first 3 nine weeks and the Final exam grade-this will consist of the average of the first 3 nine weeks. This calculation contributes 80% of the grade will be the time the students were physically in school.

span.style: font-size: 12pt; font-family: Arial; color: #000000; background-color: transparent; font-weight: 700; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap
font-size: 12pt; font-family: Arial; color: #000000; background-color: transparent; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap

p.span: The following dates will outline the dates for the remainder of the 2019/20 school year.

span.style: font-size: 12pt; font-family: Arial; color: #000000; background-color: transparent; font-weight: 700; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap
font-size: 12pt; font-family: Arial; color: #000000; background-color: transparent; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap

p.span: This will be the last day of new instruction given by the staff members.

span.style: font-size: 12pt; font-family: Arial; color: #000000; background-color: transparent; font-weight: 700; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap
font-size: 12pt; font-family: Arial; color: #000000; background-color: transparent; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap

p.span: Collecting assignments from May 1 instruction and any assignments not completed during the closure. We have encouraged students to participate all along throughout the closure, and we now encourage students to submit any and all work completed. This will also allow time for grading of the assignments.

span.style: font-size: 12pt; font-family: Arial; color: #000000; background-color: transparent; font-weight: 700; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap
font-size: 12pt; font-family: Arial; color: #000000; background-color: transparent; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap

p.span: During this time we will be assigning days for each grade level to enter the building to return textbooks, chromebooks, clean out lockers

span.style: font-size: 12pt; font-family: Arial; color: #000000; background-color: transparent; font-weight: 700; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap
font-size: 12pt; font-family: Arial; color: #000000; background-color: transparent; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap

p.span: and gather any personal items remaining in the building. We will be practicing precautions during this time as well as social distancing. Staff members will be available to direct the allowable amount of students in the building/classroom at one time. The hours for this will be 3PM - 6PM on your scheduled day. Please assist us with the gathering issue.

Scott Rolfe
Superintendent
Valley Local School District

p.span: This message is regarding cap & gown pickup this Saturday.

span.style: font-size: 14pt; font-family: "Times New Roman"; background-color: transparent; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap

p.span: Please plan to pick up your cap & gown order between the hours of 10am and 12pm this Saturday, April 25

font-size: 14pt; font-family: "Times New Roman"; background-color: transparent; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap

p.span: in front of Valley High School.

span.style: font-size: 14pt; font-family: "Times New Roman"; background-color: transparent; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap

p.span: Please drive through and do NOT exit your vehicle.

div.span: Message from Mrs. Shelly Williams the Middle School Yearbook Advisor

div.style: color: #222222; font-family: verdana, sans-serif; font-size: large; background-color: #ffffff

span.div: Hey VMS! I need to ask for your help. Yearbook sales on the Valley website end on April 29-thats coming really soon. I will need some photos to finish out the yearbook. If you would like to send me a photo of you during quarantine doing school work, playing outside, reading a book, taking a hike, whatever, please email ONLY ONE to me at [email protected].

div.style: color: #222222; font-family: verdana, sans-serif; font-size: large; background-color: #ffffff

span.div: It just MAY appear in the yearbook.

div.style: color: #222222; font-family: verdana, sans-serif; font-size: large; background-color: #ffffff

span.div: Remember to place your order if you haven't already done so.

div.style: color: #222222; font-family: verdana, sans-serif; font-size: large; background-color: #ffffff

span.div: Have a great week!

color: #ff0000

span.div: The following Letter of Intent and Shawnee State University application needs to be submitted to Guidance Office by May 1, 2020. Here are the following ways you can get the completed forms back to us by the May 1st deadline: 1. Drop off the completed two forms on Wednesdays in April from 11 A.M. - 12 noon outside in front of VHS (keeping social distancing); 2. Email pictures of the completed forms to [email protected] or [email protected]; 3. Fax to Guidance Office at (740) 259-6639; 4. Mail to Valley High School Guidance Office at 1821 St. Rt. 728, Lucasville, OH 45648.

div.div: Click on following attachments for forms:

div.a: Free COVID-19 Information from Lumos Learning

span.div: Click to Read More

span.style: background-color: #ffffff; color: #1c1e21; font-family: Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif; font-size: 14px

div.span: Parents, just some things to mention. One thing was to mention students from 3rd through 12th Grade have School Google Accounts. They should be able to login with their own account to do work. If they are having trouble, make sure that they are putting the @

a.style: font-family: inherit; font-size: 14px; color: #385898; cursor: pointer

span.style: background-color: #ffffff; color: #1c1e21; font-family: Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif; font-size: 14px
background-color: #ffffff; color: #1c1e21; font-family: Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif; font-size: 14px

div.span: after their username. All student accounts are their last name then first initial and the year they graduate. So, for example, a 3rd grader with the name John Doe would be doej29.(29 is 2029 the year they grad

span.style: color: #1c1e21; font-family: inherit; font-size: 14px

div.style: font-family: Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif; color: #1c1e21; font-size: 14px; background-color: #ffffff
div.p: We also wanted to mention some devices you may not think of for them to do School work. A Smartphone that has apps and a tablet will most likely let them do the work they need to do. The Google Drive, Google Docs, Google Sheets, Google Slides, and Google Classroom apps will be very help for them to do their work. Chromebooks are definitely great and also Windows and Macintosh computers are great for all their school work.

As for the work that has to be done. Just do the best you can. We understand the situation many are in where internet may not be the best or technology may not be available. We just want to try the best we can to keep learning going. Many should have home instructions packets for your student. Also, please be sure and tell the students to check their email daily. They should be getting emails from their Teachers about work. Have them feel free to email their Teachers with any questions concerning the work. Also, here is the link for our Blizzard Bag Lessons where a lot of the work is posted just in case you need it:
